DataElement.preferredName: Patient Measurable Disease Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Eligibility Determination Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a patient or participant having a tumor that can be accurately measured in size based on Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors, standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment, as an eligibility criterion for participation on a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Measurable Disease Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a patient or participant having a tumor that can be accurately measured in size based on Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors, standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment, as an eligibility criterion for participation on a clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Measurable_Disease Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: A tumor that can be accurately measured in size. This information can be used to judge response to treatment.:Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com):Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that a subject has one or more measurable pathological lesions.

Concepts.longName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors
Concepts.definition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com)
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Must have measurable disease
ReferenceDocuments.description: Must have measurable disease according to RECIST criteria

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have measurable disease as defined by GOG RECIST criteria

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have at least one target lesion to be used to assess response on this protocol as defined by RECIST

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have measurable disease as defined as at least one target lesion with a minimum length of 1 cm in both long and short axis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have measurable disease as defined by RECIST 1.1 criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text_6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has a single lesion which is less than or equal to 15cm in greatest dimension?

DataElement.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Eligibility Ind-2 2018257v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
